intro: Hieracium wiesbaurianum subsp. semicinerascens, commonly known as the grey haircup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive greyish, woolly leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish composite flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its subspecies status reflects subtle morphological differences from other Hieracium species.
